com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit

Class CampaignNotificationBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit.CampaignNotificationBuilder

  • public class CampaignNotificationBuilder
extends Object
    The CampaignNotificationBuilder class displays data representing a single campaign. This uses an AlertDialog.Builder if the app is running in the foreground, or a NotificationCompat.Builder if the app is running in the background.

    The Campaign's Title and Message will automatically be displayed in the Title and Text spaces. After creating a CampaignNotificationBuilder, you may set an OnClickActivity that will open when the user taps on the Notification or AlertDialog 'OK' button. When arriving at the OnClickActivity, the Intent will have an extra String contained within its Bundle named "campaignId". This is useful for finding the particular campaign that triggered the Notification.

    You may also set a smallIcon or largeIcon in case a Notification is sent, this will be displayed in the notification bar.

    Finally, call show() to trigger the CampaignNotificationBuilder.

    Below is an example of code to use this feature: 

    
 new CampaignNotificationBuilder(CurrentActivity, campaign)
 .setSmallIcon(R.drawable.ic_launcher)
 .setOnClickActivity(CampaignDetailActivity.class)
 .show();

      • INTENT_BUNDLE_IS_ALERT

        @Deprecated
public static final String INTENT_BUNDLE_IS_ALERT
        Deprecated. As of 0.14.0, replaced by CampaignNotificationBuilder.INTENT_BUNDLE_SOURCE and CampaignNotificationBuilder.INTENT_SOURCE_ALERT. While this constant was just introduce the key it references has been in use for several versions. However, it will be removed in the next major release in favor of the more flexible source.
        The Bundle key containing the boolean flag indicating the intent was triggered by an alert.
        Since:
        0.14.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTENT_BUNDLE_IS_NOTIFICATION

        @Deprecated
public static final String INTENT_BUNDLE_IS_NOTIFICATION
        Deprecated. As of 0.14.0, replaced by CampaignNotificationBuilder.INTENT_BUNDLE_SOURCE and CampaignNotificationBuilder.INTENT_SOURCE_NOTIFICATION. While this constant was just introduce the key it references has been in use for several versions. However, it will be removed in the next major release in favor of the more flexible source.
        The Bundle key containing the boolean flag indicating the intent was triggered by a notification.
        Since:
        0.14.0
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • CampaignNotificationBuilder

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder(Context context,
                                   Campaign campaign)
        Creates an instance of CampaignNotificationBuilder with the given Context and Campaign. Note that if the given Context is not an instance of Activity, a notification will be sent rather than an alert dialog.
        Parameters:
        context - an application Context for which to build a notification
        campaign - a Campaign that the notification will be built for

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultColor

        public static Integer getDefaultColor()
        Returns the default color for notifications.
        Since:
        0.14.0

      • setDefaultColor

        public static void setDefaultColor(Integer color)
        Set the default color for notifications titles and small icons.

        This does not affect in app alerts. The color can be changed for individual notifications using CampaignNotificationBuilder.setColor(int).

        Parameters:
        color - The color to use by default for all notifications.
        Since:
        0.14.0
        See Also:
        NotificationCompat.Builder

      • show

        public void show()
        Displays the built notification.

        Behavior of this depends on the Android OS version. For versions less than API 14, this will always send a notification. For API 14 and above, if the app is in the foreground it will send an in app alert instead. For API 26 and above, background notifications will be sent on the channel ID set through CampaignNotificationBuilder.setChannelId(String). For all versions, this will send a notification when the provided Context is not an instance of Activity.

      • show

        public void show(String channelId)
        Displays the built notification.

        Behavior of this depends on the Android OS version. For versions less than API 14, this will always send a notification. For API 14 and above, if the app is in the foreground it will send an in app alert instead. For API 26 and above, background notifications will be sent on the provided channelId. For all versions, this will send a notification when the provided Context is not an instance of Activity.

        The provided channelId is used in-place of any ID set through CampaignNotificationBuilder.setChannelId(String) for this call only. Use CampaignNotificationBuilder.setChannelId(String) to set a persistent channel ID for this notification.

        Parameters:
        channelId - id for the NotificationChannel the constructed notification will be posted on
        Since:
        0.14.0

      • setCancelable

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setCancelable(boolean flag)
        Sets whether the alert dialog will have a cancel button.

        This does not affect notifications.

        Parameters:
        flag - a boolean flag indicating the alert's cancelable status
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with flag indicating if it is cancelable
        Since:
        0.12.0

      • setChannelId

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setChannelId(String channelId)
        Sets the NotificationChannel ID for Android O (API 26).
        Parameters:
        channelId - id for the NotificationChannel the constructed notification will be posted on
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with provided channel ID
        Since:
        0.14.0

      • setColor

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setColor(int color)
        Set the color for this notification's title and small icon.

        This does not affect in app alerts. This is color will be used instead of the default color.

        Parameters:
        color - The color to use for this notification.
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with the specified color
        Since:
        0.14.0
        See Also:
        NotificationCompat.Builder

      • setOnClickActivity

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setOnClickActivity(Class activity)
        Updates the activity that will start when the alert/notification is clicked

        This does not affect alerts.

        Parameters:
        activity - Activity class for the notification on click intent
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with updated activity

      • setTheme

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setTheme(int themeResId)
        Set an explicit theme resource for the notification.

        The specified theme resource (themeResId) is applied on top of the parent context's theme (set in the constructor). Alternatively, the themeResId may be specified as 0 to use the parent context's resolved value for alertDialogTheme. The default theme resource used to generate the notifications is 0.

        Parameters:
        themeResId - the resource ID of the theme against which to inflate this dialog, or 0 to use the parent context's default alert dialog theme
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with the custom theme resource
        See Also:
        AlertDialog.AlertDialog(Context, int), AlertDialog

      • setLargeIcon

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setLargeIcon(Bitmap largeIcon)
        Updates the large icon for the notification.

        This does not affect alerts.

        Parameters:
        largeIcon - a bitMap representing the large icon
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with updated large icon

      • setSmallIcon

        public CampaignNotificationBuilder setSmallIcon(int smallIcon)
        Updates the small icon of the notification.
        Parameters:
        smallIcon - a bitMap representing the small icon
        Returns:
        this CampaignNotificationBuilder with updated small icon
